Description: Mould-made pottery `pitcher' lamp with a tall carinated body. The wick-hole is placed within a wide pointed projection; in the wall above it are two rows each of four pierced holes. The wide filling-hole is surrounded by a raised rim. The upper shoulder is decorated with a row of vertical impressions. At the rear is a grooved pierced handle with voluted spines, and a handle-ornament above in the form of an ivy-leaf. The raised base is concave below; within are the impressed letters XI or IX. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q532.bis)
